research_summary: The San Francisco 49ers' Super Bowl aspirations crashed in a heartbreaking 31-7 defeat against the Philadelphia Eagles in the NFC Championship game on January 29, 2023. A promising season, fueled by the emergence of rookie quarterback Brock Purdy, abruptly derailed due to a series of unfortunate events. key_facts: Brock Purdy suffered an elbow injury early in the first quarter, significantly impacting his throwing ability.
The Eagles sacked 49ers quarterbacks a total of 4 times.
The 49ers committed 3 turnovers compared to the Eagles' 0.
Philadelphia outrushed San Francisco 148 yards to 81 yards.
The Eagles scored 21 unanswered points in the second and third quarters.
